strIntroduction: This is a special offer for all Kamakura tourists! We will bring you to the pleasant Junisho area in Kamakura, also known by the locals as the “Tibet” of Kamakura. There you will be able to try yoga meditation in the morning before discovering some of the town's best Buddhist temples. Start the day with a morning yoga lesson before going on a nice walk through the small streets of Junisho area to discover the beautiful Zen temple Jomyoji and also Hokokuji which boasts a wonderful bamboo garden. You can drink traditional Japanese green tea in the temple's garden. The private yoga studio is located in a very quiet place down the mountain. The entire surroundings are full of history, and this is the perfect place to practice yoga meditation. You will feel the Zen atmosphere of Kamakura while viewing the forest from the studio's windows. Below is the schedule for this tour: 07:40 am - Pick up at Kamakura Station (East Exit) Take a bus to the yoga studio 08:00 - Start of the yoga class Walk to the temples 10:00 - Visit Jomyoji and Hokokuji Temples 12:00 - End of the tour
strTitle: Refresh body and soul with yoga and a Kamakura tour

strIntroduction: In this tour you will ride the Shinkansen bullet train from Tokyo to Oyama Station in Tochigi prefecture. A special bus or taxi will then take you to one of the most popular strawberry farms located in the middle of the rural farms. The beginning of the year in Japan is a great time to experience "strawberry hunting" - a special type of fruit picking in which you are allowed to pick and eat as many strawberries as you want for 30 minutes! At the end of this tour you will return to Tokyo with the Shinkansen with a full stomach and fantastic memories! The schedule of the tour is as follows: Weekends: 8:28 - Take Shinkansen Nasuno from Tokyo Station 9:09 - Arrive at JR Oyama Station 9:15 - Take the special bus or taxi from the West Exit of Oyama Station. Please note that if you're late you will have to arrange the transportation yourself. 10:15 - Arrive at Sano Premium Outlets. Free time in Sano for shopping and lunch of your choice (not included in the tour price). You will also receive discount coupons for various shops. 14:00 - Transfer Sano Premium Outlets to the strawberry farm 14:30 - Arrive at the strawberry farm for strawberry picking and a 40-minute "all-you-can-eat" sweets buffet or pancake set. 15:50 - Depart from the strawberry farm and arrive at JR Oyama Station 16:30~ Take Shinkansen Nasuno or Yamabiko back to Tokyo Please be punctual with the time because the special bus/taxi has a fixed schedule. This tour is only offered on irregular weekend days from mid-January until the spring.
strTitle: Strawberry hunting, shopping & local sweets tour in Tochigi

strIntroduction: Kanaya Port is a small town located on the east side of Tokyo Bay. It's located in Chiba prefecture, just about 1.5-2 hours from Tokyo by train. In this self-guided tour you will visit the beautiful port town and will enjoy a pleasant day surrounded by beautiful nature and delicious seafood! Lunch is included in this tour and you will have the opportunity to eat a special seafood rice bowl at one of the town's best fish restaurants. There is an additional dish - the local specialty grilled abalone! You'll be surprised by its delicious and juicy taste. After lunch you have two options to choose from: 1. Ride on the Tokyo Bay Ferry which crosses the bay and connects Chiba prefecture's Kanaya Port with Kanagawa prefecture's Kurihama Port. Taking this ferry guarantees that you will have a pleasant afternoon in the sea. You will even see the unique highway Tokyo Bay Aqua-Line which becomes an underwater tunnel midway - with an artificial island turned into a service area! Please note that this is a round-trip ferry and you cannot disembark at Kurihama Port. You can only ride the ferry departing from Kanaya Port at 13:15 or the next one departing at 14:20. 2. Take the ropeway up to Mt Nokogiri - a unique "saw-shaped" mountain with a spectacular view over the entire valley and bay seen from the symbolic steep rock on the top. Right next to it is Nihonji - a massive Buddhist mountain complex, home to the largest pre-modern stone-carved Buddha in Japan. You can take this tour every day when it's seasonally available (usually throughout the year). You can choose between normal/rapid trains and limited express trains (Sazanami). One-way trip takes about 1.5-2 hours depending on the train. Please note that limited express trains run mainly in the weekends and not all of them stop at JR Hamakanaya Station. If you take a limited express train you can board the train either at Tokyo or Shinjuku stations. The fish restaurant is located at the ferry port, about 5 minutes away from JR Hamakanaya Station. The ferry ride takes about 100 minutes. The ropeway is 10-15 minutes south of the station.
strTitle: Seafood and natural wonders near Tokyo Bay and Mt Nokogiri

strIntroduction: Chiba prefecture spans over Boso Peninsula, south of Narita Airport and east of Tokyo Bay. The southern part of that peninsula (known also as Minami-Boso) has a wide array of natural and cultural sightseeing spots to visit, as well as plenty of interesting experiences for every taste! The tour around the picturesque coastal landscape is ideal for couples, friends, families and guests of Tokyo who want to see the rural face of Japan but do not have time to spend more than one or two days outside of the capital city. This can be booked as a guided tour, but there is no fixed itinerary! The price includes a round trip from Tokyo and a special transportation pass for unlimited rides of the trains and buses in the entire area for 2 days, therefore you can visit as many facilities and sightseeing spots as you want! In order to avoid problems with transportation and getting lost (especially when riding local buses or finding some remote facilities), we strongly recommend additionally booking a guide for this tour. Besides, the guide will tell you so many interesting things about the region and will recommend amazing local restaurants! Choose between a day trip or a two-day tour, which includes one night stay in Chiba's rural south. The interesting spots are spread across a vast area so we recommend staying overnight in order to fully enjoy the idyllic beauty of Boso Peninsula. Here is a list of recommended places to visit. Pick your favourites and inform your guide, or ask them to recommend something for you: 1. Kamogawa Seaworld: One of Japan's finest and most popular aquariums. A great variety of marine life to see, including polar sea animals like penguins and sea otters. Unique live shows with dolphins, beluga whales, sea lions and killer whales are held several times per day. One of the two places in Japan to see killer whale shows! 2. Mt Nokogiri and Nihonji Temple: A unique "saw-shaped" mountain with a spectacular view over the entire valley and bay seen from the symbolic steep rock on the top. Nihonji Temple is a massive Buddhist mountain complex, home to the largest pre-modern stone-carved Buddha in Japan. 3. Tateyama city: Some of the city's highlights are Tateyama Castle on the top of the scenic Shiroyama Park Hill, former Akayama air-raid shelters - a labirynth of underground caves and tunnels that are open to the public, Tateyama Family Park where you can enjoy not only the flower gardens but also eat rare tropical fruits, Okinoshima uninhabited island which is connected to the city through a small strip of sand, and many others. 4. Futomi Flower Center: Besides enjoying the spacious flower garden, you can experience fishing red sea bream and have it cooked for you at the nearby restaurant! 5. Niemonjima island: Take aboat to this small rocky island which has lots of historical monuments and rare plants. Japan's shogun Minamoto-no-Yoritomo hid in a cave on this island after he was defeated in a military battle. 6. Tainoura pleasure boat: Take a boat trip around the rocky coastal line of Tainoura bay and see some interesting natural spots. 7. Shopping and eating local farm products and delicacies at various "Michi no Eki" farm centers: in Chikura, Wadaura and Tomiura. Please consult your preferences for the itinerary with your guide as the facilities are spread across a vast area.
strTitle: Explore freely the picturesque countryside of southern Chiba

strIntroduction: This is a one day trip from Tokyo. We leave Tokyo at 6:00 am and about 3 hours later, we arrive at a small harbor in Iwaki city, Fukushima prefecture. Then, we switch to the fishing boat, which has a maximum capacity of 20 people. This means that other then the owner and the guide, we accept 18 guests maximum for the tour. The tour takes 4 hours on the ocean. First, we pass by Hirono thermal power generation which provides 70% of the Tokyo energy after 3/11 (2011). Then Fukushima Daini nuclear power plant, which survived the huge earthquake and did not explode (although it was really close, they say). After Daini is Tomioka town, the home town of the boat owner. This place is now filled with piled contaminated dirt. Passing by another small harbor, Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant appears. We will catch a fish in front of it, and then head to a brand new sea wind power generation, and finally go back to the harbor around 1:00 pm. The fishing boat is small. We have pills for sea sickness ready for you. Also if you are worried, we will have Tyvek suits for you to wear, although we will be carrying geiger counters along with the tour, so you will know that the radiation is not at any level to worry about. We eat a late lunch at Yotsukura harbor, which is 15 minutes away. After that, we go around Naraha and Tomioka to see how the towns have become empty after the accident. Fukushima is originally a prefecture widely known for good quality Onsen, hot springs. At last, we will stop by at Iwaki Yumoto for Onsen, and arrive Ryogoku Station in Tokyo around 9:00 pm.
strTitle: See Fukushima Daiichi Power Plant with your own eyes

strIntroduction: This activity is offered from 19:00 to 23:00 (you can join and leave any time). I will take you to some of Tokyo's hottest nightlife areas where we will drink together and enjoy the night. We attend different bars every night. Here is a list of my recommendations: World Highballm Midpark Cafe, Hachienda Del Cielo in Daikanyama, Rigoletto in Roppongi Hills, Blacklist Afterwork Party at 1967, What the dickens British bar in Ebisu, Buri standing bar in Ebisu, 6th by Oriental Hotel, Waterfront Canal Cafe, Aoyama Craft Beer Market at United Nations University, Public Viewing at sports bar, Oak Door in Grand Hyatt, Roof Top Bar in Andaz on the 52nd foor at Toranomon Hills, Yonayona Kitchen at Omohara Beer Forest at Omotesando, Happy Hour at Peter the bar at the Peninsula on the 24th floor, Resort bar Cicada in Omotesando, Brew Dog Brewery in Roppongi, Spring Valley Brewery in Daikanyama, and many more! This activity is usually offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners, but if you wish, I can guide you privately to a bar of your choice. I can certainly introduce you to the hottest nightlife places in Tokyo!
strTitle: Hang out with a local in a Tokyo bar

strIntroduction: For this tour we will meet at Nakameguro Station (on Tokyo subway Hibiya line or Tokyu Toyoko Line) at 3:30pm. We will then explore the Nakameguro shopping street full of unique boutiques and part of the hip river-side area before visiting the century-old Asakura house opened to the public by the government as an important cultural property of Japan. After that, we will go back to exploring the river-side area where we will have dinner at a hard-to-book Japanese chicken restaurant. We will finish dinner at around 8pm. After dinner, if you would like to stay and explore nightlife in Nakameguro, I will give you tips on where to go. There are lots of trendy and unique bars and cafes where you can have a peek into how cool Tokyoites enjoy nightlife in the world's biggest city. Please note that this might not be a private tour.
strTitle: Discover Nakameguro through sake and typical chicken dishes

strIntroduction: Ishinomaki is a major seaside city on the Sanriku Coast in Tohoku (North Japan). In March 2011 Ishinomaki suffered significant damage from the powerful earthquake and especially the resulting tsunami. The city's recovery has attracted plenty of attention due to the reliance on local efforts and the miraculous support of all the manga characters associated with the famous Ishinomori Manga Museum. This is a 2-day tour to the beautiful and dramatic Sanriku Coast where you will have the rare opportunity to see how local people join forces to preserve the historical traditions of Ishinomaki while looking forward to a new, brighter future. In this curious and enlightening tour you will explore the quiet seaside city of Ishinomaki and learn everything about its past and present. You will visit a traditional sake brewery, see how locals live at temporary housings and shopping facilities, ride on a medieval ship, eat delicious seafood, and meet the famous manga characters who protect Ishinomaki with their brave spirits! This is a unique 2-day tour to a real "off-the-beaten-track" destination where you can observe the authentic lifestyle of local people in the Japanese countryside. The following is the itinerary for the tour: Day 1 8:00 - Take the Shinkansen bullet train from Tokyo station to Sendai (recommended train - Yamabiko 175), then change to the local Senseki line train to Ishinomaki (recommended train departs Sendai at 10:14 and arrives in Ishinomaki at 11:18). 11:30 - Meet your guide at Ishinomaki station and head towards a classy local restaurant named Takikawa to try fresh seafood delicacies. 12:40 - 13:00 - Visit Ishinomaki's Information Center and get acquainted with the tragic story of the disaster and the persevering recovery efforts. 13:05 - 14:05 - Go to the famous Ishinomori Manga Museum, built as a tribute to the prominent manga author Shotaro Ishinomori, father of classical series such as Cyborg 009, Kamen Rider, Goranger and many others. Learn how anime fans from all over the country helped the city's recovery. 14:15 - 14:45 - Take a look over Ishinomaki from the top of Hiyoriyama Park and see the current stages of the recovery process along the bay 15:10 - 16:20 - Go see San Juan Bautista, a restored European-style sailing ship used for Japanese envoys to the West at the beginning of the Edo period. 16:40 - Check in at the wonderful Hanayubi Hotel in Onagawa Onsen and relax in an open-air hot spring pool overlooking the sea. Day 2 9:30 - Get picked up from the hotel and go straight to Hirako Shuzo, Ishinomaki's own sake brewery. 11:35 - 12:00 - Pay a visit to the remains of Kadonowaki Elementary School and learn about the positive outcome of the dramatic events that happened here in March 2011. 12:15 - 13:45 - Go to Ishinomaki's fish market and have lunch with fresh seafood at Saitaro dining hall where locals go for lunch. 14:10 - 14:45 - Visit the temporary shopping facilities built for people who lost their property after the tsunami. Feel the positive hope for the future that locals here have. 15:00 - Do some last-minute shopping of local products and souvenirs at Ishinomaki's tourist center. Even little gestures help the city's people and speed up the recovery process. 15:50 - End the tour at Ishinomaki station. Take the train back to Sendai and change for the Shinkansen bullet train bound for Tokyo (recommended train departs from Sendai station at 17:09 and arrives at Tokyo station at 18:52). Important: Restaurants and facilities on the itinerary might change as some of them are closed on particular days of the week. In such cases alternatives will be provided. Transportation, accommodation, and meals (2 lunches, 1 dinner, 1 breakfast) are included. This is a private tour with guides and transportation arranged specially for you. This is a specially designed tour that you can book only with us. You will not find this tour at any other travel company. Try it as a 2-day trip during your visit to Japan and discover beautiful hidden places that do not appear in standard guide books and travel packages.
strTitle: See the restoration of the seaside manga city Ishinomaki

strIntroduction: The Matsushima Bay area in Tohoku (North Japan) includes the peaceful fishermen towns of Shiogama and Matsushima that offer unique opportunities for experiencing a relaxing stay at the Pacific seaside. Rather than spending your time at luxurious touristic resorts, you will have the chance to feel the authentic atmosphere of small rural towns and discover their genuine charm. In this 2-day tour you will visit two of Japan's most picturesque seaside towns and explore their hidden attractive spots. See how local people have been relying on their bond with the sea for ages and feel the refreshing breeze as you enjoy the scenic view of Matsushima's pine-tree islands! In this pleasant tour you will visit two neighboring fishermen's towns (Shiogama and Matsushima) and find a top-class sake brewery with a well-preserved old warehouse, a majestic shrine with a long history, delicious sushi with fresh seafood, unique temples with splendid Japanese gardens, and plenty of picturesque natural scenery! Below is the itinerary for this relaxing tour to the countryside towns: Day 1 8:00 - Take the Shinkansen bullet train from Tokyo station to Sendai station, and then change to the local Senseki line to Hon-Shiogama station (the recommended train departs from Sendai at 10:17 and arrives at Hon-Shiogama at 10:45). 10:55 - Meet your guide and go to Urakasumi Sake Brewery where you will find an impressive old-style warehouse where some of Japan's best-quality sake is produced. 12:25 - 13:25 - Eat delicious sushi with fresh seafood at Sushi Tetsu, one of Shiogama's many sushi restaurants. 13:35 - 14:25 - Visit the impressive Shiogama Shrine and learn more about the history and legends of the fishermen town. 15:00 - 15:50 - Ride a scenic sightseeing boat from Shiogama to Matsushima and see many of the famous pine-tree islands along the way. The bay with hundreds of pine islands is considered to be one of Japan's three most scenic views. 16:15 - Check in at Hotel Matsushima Onsen Ichinobo, which will impress you with its luxurious interior and an open-air hot spring pool overlooking the ocean. Day 2 9:00 - Get picked up from the hotel and go to the Matsushima seaside area to explore the town's historical wonders on foot: the gorgeous temples Zuiganji and Entsuin, which have attractive Japanese-style gardens, the Buddhist relic Godaido Hall, the tea house Kanrantei, and much more! Enjoy hands-on activities and eat fresh seafood for lunch. 16:21 - Go to Matsushima-Kaigan station where the tour ends. Recommended return trip to Tokyo: take the local train departing at 16:21 from Matsushima-Kaigan station and arrive at Sendai station at 16:49. Then take the Shinkansen bullet train at 17:09 and arrive at Tokyo station at 18:52. Transportation, accommodation, and meals (2 lunches, 1 dinner, 1 breakfast) are included. This is a private tour with guides and transportation arranged specially for you. This is a specially designed tour that you can book only with us. You will not find this tour at any other travel company. Try it as a 2-day trip during your visit to Japan and discover beautiful hidden places that do not appear in standard guide books and travel packages.
strTitle: Relax with delicious sake and seafood at Matsushima Bay area

strIntroduction: The Oku Aizu region in Tohoku (North Japan) offers experiences that will transport you back in time to the ages of simplicity, rural lifestyles, and pristine nature. The deep mountainous area of Oku Aizu (literally "inner Aizu") is a well preserved world of authenticity where you can discover hidden villages, magical natural scenery, eco-friendly food and local sake, relaxing hot springs, traditional crafts that can't be found anywhere else, and much more! By booking this 2-day private tour you will have the rare chance to discover a real "off-the-beaten-track" destination that does not have a touristic atmosphere and will satisfy your adventurous spirit! In this tour you will explore Oku Aizu's little villages located along the ravine of the winding Tadami River. You will stay in a traditional style local ryokan inn just beside the river stream and will be able to relax in several different hot spring pools. You will eat delicious local food, try some of Japan's top-ranked sake, and engage in traditional craft activities to experience the ordinary lifestyle of the village people. Below are the itinerary and highlights of this unique tour that you will never forget: Day 1 8:08 - Take the Shinkansen bullet train from Tokyo to Koriyama Station (recommended train: Yamabiko 127) and change to the local train on Banetsu-sai line at 9:40. 10:54 - Arrive at Aizu-Wakamatsu Station where you will be picked up by the guide and will go to Akebono Sake Brewery with private transportation. You will be able to explore the traditional style brewery from inside for more than an hour. 12:40 - 13:20 - Have lunch at a local restaurant serving hand-made soba (buckwheat noodles). 14:10 - 15:10 - Visit the legendary Lake Numazawa and choose between casual trekking around the lake or a canoe experience over the tranquil water surface. 15:30 - 16:45 - Go to "Karamushi-ori no Sato", a traditional craft village where you can try the local art of ramie fiber weaving on an old-style loom. 17:15 - Check-in at "Ebisuya", a cosy ryokan inn located just beside the river and relax in its numerous hot spring pools. Day 2 8:30 - Pick-up from your inn and go directly to Oku Aizu's best panorama view point where you will be able to see the rural train cross a spectacular bridge over Tadami River. This is a fantastic opportunity to take great photos. 10:00 - 11:30 - Try the art of weaving and knitting wild grape skin to make your own amulet at Mishima town's "Seikatsu Kogeikan" atelier. Learn about this traditional craft that is an important part of the lives of Oku Aizu's people and see some very expensive fine art items. 11:45 - 12:45 - Have lunch at a real log house in the forest! Eat a deliciously-prepared meal in a relaxed environment enjoyed by locals. 13:15 - 14:00 - Visit the majestic Enzoji Temple built on a cliff overlooking Tadami River and discover the legend of the famous local toy "akabeko" (the red cow). 14:45 - 16:00 - Go to Aizu-Wakamatsu and visit the impressive Tsuruga Castle that fascinates with its white walls and red-tile roof. 16:00 - Return to Aizu-Wakamatsu Station where the tour ends. Recommended Shinkansen bullet train for a return to Tokyo - Yamabiko 152 (arrives at Tokyo station at 19:24). Transportation, accommodation, and meals (2 lunches, 1 dinner, 1 breakfast) are included. This is a private tour with guides and transportation arranged specially for you. This is a specially designed tour that you can book only with us. You will not find this tour at any other travel company. Try it as a 2-day trip during your visit to Japan and discover beautiful hidden places that do not appear in standard guide books and travel packages.
strTitle: Discover the real rural Japan and its traditions in Oku Aizu

strIntroduction: In this activity you will go to a Japanese karaoke venue and sing songs in Japanese, English, and other languages for two hours. For kids and fans, there are anime songs too! You can sing songs while reading the lyrics on a screen and enjoy the original video clips that accompany many of the songs. Sometimes you can even see the original singer's performance on the screen! The price includes the guide fee only. I will come with you and we will have fun together at karaoke! The price does not include the karaoke fees which depend on the facility. I will take you to a casual and inexpensive place where you will have to order at least one drink per person. There is a variety of drinks, such as beer, cocktails, sake, whiskey, and soft drinks. If you are hungry, we can order some food for an extra fee too. Be sure to challenge yourself by checking your singing score on the machine! A karaoke experience is something you must try when visiting Japan!
strTitle: Enjoy a very fun karaoke experience in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: This is a walking tour around the quaint streets of the Asakusa district in Tokyo. Besides seeing the city's oldest temples and surrounding shopping streets that look as if they come directly from the Edo period, you will also have the chance to discover Japan's largest kitchen goods street (Kappabashi Street) and eat many local sweets. Join us for this casual and fun tour! Please note: Join us after having had lunch since we will eat lots of sweets! Below are the details of the tour: Tour time: 13:00-16:00 (3 hours) Available: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday Tour language: English
strTitle: Explore Asakusa's wonders and sweets on a walking tour!

strIntroduction: Arashiyama is a place dear to the Japanese for it's classical tales imbedded in the history of Japan and simply for it's spectacular views and splendid temples. The iconic scene of Arashiyama is seeing the passenger boats gliding across the broad Oi River and the beautiful Togetsukyō (Moon Crossing) Bridge. This is a place with an almost magical quality that is simply a must see while you are in Japan. Tenryuji Temple: Once we arrive the first stop will simply have to be the amazing World Heritage Tenryuji Temple. This Zen temple is beautiful inside and out. As you walk through the open air temple looking at the art on the sliding doors, you can view one of the most famous gardens in Japan. This is the pioneer in using borrowed landscape, that is shaping the garden to blend with the landscape in the back drop. Simply stunning and in my opinion one of the nicest gardens I have ever seen in Japan. Bamboo Grove: Right around the corner is the Bamboo Grove. Walking through here gives you a spine tingling experience you will never forget. This is considered one of the must see sights in Japan and is famously on the cover of the Lonely Planet guide to Japan. Here, and everywhere along the way, I will be happy to take pictures for you so you can treasure the memory for years to come Monkey Mountain: A trip to Japan is not complete without getting a chance to meet a wild monkey! The chance to see them so close to a major city is even more rare. This mountain is a sanctuary for monkeys and overs you the rare chance of feeding them nuts from within a secure fenced room on the top of the hill. This climb to the top is worth it just for the view of the city below. Rent a Bike Option: Buzz around town and check out some of the lesser know but equally intriguing temples and shrines. Hot Springs Option: A short 10min ride away and you can experience the rich mineral waters of a natural hot spring. A definite must try while in Japan. All along the way I will be happy to share with you my knowledge of Japanese history and culture including the foundations of the religions and customs of the land. This is a fun and relaxing way to see a beautiful gem in Kyoto and I am sure you will love it. As this is a popular tour, inquire now with your preferred dates and we will try to get you booked in for this memorable experience.
strTitle: Experience Arashiyama!

strIntroduction: This is a cooking lesson in which you will learn about the secrets of Japanese Washoku cooking from a professional bilingual chef. The meals are traditionally divided into several degrees of difficulty: "Matsu (pine)", "Take (bamboo)", and "Ume (plum)". All of them use seasonal ingredients. Here are a few examples of main dishes from each course: [Plum – Ume - 2 hours] 1 main dish Example: Okonomiyaki (Japanese pancake), Oyako-don (chicken and egg), Nori-maki (sushi hand roll), Maki-zushi (sushi roll), Udon [Bamboo – Take - 3 hours] 1 soup and three dishes (1 main dish / 2 side dishes / 1 miso soup / multi grain rice) or Hot pot Example: Saba no Miso-ni (boiled mackerel with miso flavor), Shouga-yaki (ginger pork), Sukiyaki [Pine – Matsu- 5 hours] The details of this course is currently not available for booking. All courses have English recipes included so that you can practice making the dishes at home. Some courses can be provided for vegetarians. Please ask if you have a specific request. About the chef: Marimo is a professional chef. She promotes an abundance of simple and healthy vegetables in home cooking by taking advantage of seasonal ingredients. Her recipes, based on Japanese home cooking with seasonal ingredients, are full of her original ideas and are loved by many people of all generations. She is an expert in medicinal home cooking and a recipe-creator who teaches all kinds of Japanese cuisine in English at her salon in Aoyama. She also works as a private chef and catering and food stylist for TV-shows, commercials, and magazines. She published her first recipe book "Kurashino-koyomi" in 2013. In addition, after the lesson you can book also a dinner in a unique izakaya which has a traditional Kyoto atmosphere even though it's located in central Tokyo, and a ticket for the spectacular Robot Restaurant show in Shinjuku. Here are some suggested schedules for this activity: Meet at the specified place in Minami-Aoyama at 10:20am → Cooking experience begins at 10:30 am → Cooking experience ends 1:30pm → Optional add-on of one of the plans below. Plan A Meet at the Robot Restaurant ticket counter at 3:20pm → Robot Show begins at 4:00pm → Show ends at 5:30pm Move to the restaurant → Dinner at 6:00pm for up to 120 minutes Plan B Meet at Robot Restaurant ticket counter at 5:15pm → Robot Show begins at 5:55pm → Show ends at 7:25pm Move to the restaurant → Dinner at 8:00pm for up to 120 minutes Plan C Dinner at 5:00pm → Move to the Robot Restaurant Meet at the ticket counter at 7:10pm → Show begins at 7:50pm → Show ends at 9:20pm Plan D Dinner at 6:30 pm → Move to the Robot Restaurant Meet at the ticket counter at 9:05pm → Show begins at 9:45pm → Show ends at 11:15pm Note: There is no guide for the add-on option (Robot Restaurant and izakaya dinner). You will go there by yourself.
strTitle: Experience Washoku cooking lesson with seasonal ingredients

strIntroduction: This is a tour to Nagoya's famous Toyota Commemorative Museum where the guide will introduce you to the unique Japanese concept of "Kaizen" (continuous improvement), implemented by Toyota in the decades after World War II. After the tour you will be able to taste local food and sweets. Schedule details: - Start at 9:00am and end at 2:30pm after lunch - Meet at the lobby of Nagoya Marriott Associa Hotel (directly above Nagoya Station) - Go to the Toyota Commemorative Museum The museum exhibits textile machinery, which was one of the core industries that helped build modern Japan, and the evolving world of automobile engineering that continues to drive the country's development. You will be surprised to see 100-year-old textile machinery still working properly with regular maintenance. Your private English-speaking guide will help you understand how the spirit of Kaizen was embodied into the initial textile machinery and also in the present automobile manufacturing. At the museum, you will enjoy a very unique demonstration by Toyota's sophisticated robot which plays a musical instrument as if a real music artist plays. After moving back to Nagoya station, your guide will take you to a favorite local restaurant for lunch. Your guide will give you some additional information on souvenir shopping and local sweets. *The schedule can be flexible upon requests from the guest.
strTitle: Discover the Kaizen Spirit and Taste Local Food in Nagoya

strIntroduction: ***Sorry, we cannot match a solo student with another group.*** Once you learn the art of Kintsugi (golden joinery with Japanese Urushi lacquer), you will be able to repair your own broken pottery and porcelain in your own home! Our instructor will teach you the traditional Japanese method while you repair your own item in our studio. We will provide all of the materials. Traditionally, the number of lessons required for completion of the repair process is a minimum of 4 lessons over a month. However, this workshop is only part 1 of 4, so we will explain to you how to continue the repair process at home. Urushi-related-supplies are available for sale at our store. The workshop usually lasts 90 to 120 minutes. If you have your own broken ceramics, please bring it with you. Make sure that your item is small, as you'll need to travel with it during the entire trip. Alternatively, we will prepare a broken plate for you. We would like to forewarn you that Urushi lacquer contains a compound that can cause a reaction similar to that of poison ivy, however proper handling (gloves and a long-sleeve shirt), as well as working in a well-ventilated area will generally prevent an allergic reaction. As a precaution, hypo-allergenic Urushi is used in our studio. Your party has to be a minimum of two people to run this activity.
strTitle: Learn the Art of Kintsugi (Golden Joinery) Repair in Tokyo

strIntroduction: This is a specialized guided tour for lovers of fishing who wish to explore Japan's high-quality fishing tackle shops in Osaka. I will introduce you to some of the country's finest fishing rods, reels, and lures. The tour will last about 5-6 hours and will include lunch. Here are the benefits of this tour: - I will introduce you to the very best fishing goods in Japan - I will help you with my specialized knowledge about fishing. Ordinary guide-interpreters are expensive and may not understand the specialized terminology well. - You will save valuable time and will not need to worry about how to find and reach the best shops in the area. You will be able to complete this tour in just less than one day, while it would typically take about 2 days to explore the shops by yourself.
strTitle: Explore the best fishing tools shops in Osaka with an expert

strIntroduction: This is a specially designed tour in Kobe city for Muslim tourists. The itinerary can be customized according to your preferences. Here is a sample itinerary: 1) Meet at your hotel in Kobe or JR Sannomiya station 2) Visit Kobe Meriken Park by taking the "Kobe City Loop Bus" - Enjoy the beautiful sea and mountain views of Kobe. - A flea market is held at the Meriken Park almost every weekend so you may be able to purchase very unique Japanese products at a reasonable price. - Kobe Port Tower and Port of Kobe Earthquake Memorial Park are located in Meriken Park. 3) Kobe Harborland and Lunch - Kobe Harborland is one of the most attractive shopping areas in Kobe. Kobe is known as a city of fashion so you may be able to find various shops which offer very original and stylish products made in Kobe such as shoes and bags. - Shops of Studio Ghibli, Ultraman, and Hello Kitty are available as well so Japanese anime lovers can enjoy the venue. - Lunch at a restaurant or a food court which offers Muslim friendly menu. I will make sure that you will be able to order pork and alcohol-free dishes. 4) Kobe Mosque, Kobe Halal Food (supermarket), Kitano Kobo - Take the City Loop Bus to the next area from Kobe Harborland. However, if the bus is too crowded, we may take another transportation such as the train as an alternative. - Allocate time for prayer and visit supermarkets where you can buy all kinds of halal products. - Visit Kitano Koubou which is an ex-elementary school building renovated as a souvenir shop selling local Kobe products. As Kobe is very famous for its various confectionery, I will assist you in purchasing pork and alcohol-free products as souvenirs. 5) Walk to the JR Sannomiya station where the tour will end *I can rearrange the itinerary and make it quite flexible depending on your schedule and places you would like to visit.
strTitle: Book an exciting Muslim-friendly tour in Kobe

strIntroduction: "Yukata de Nara" is a rental kimono (yukata) service that provides a 1.5-hour afternoon sightseeing guided tour in Nara. We can pick you up at your hotel in Nara around 10:00-11:30 am. Select your favorite antique yukata and accessories, put it on with our support, and then enjoy free time strolling around Nara where you can find many old landmarks, temples, shrines, and even the virgin forest behind Kasugayama (a map will be provided by us). We'll meet again in front of the famous Japanese garden Isuien around 14:30-15:00. Then we'll take a rest with Japanese matcha tea at a nice tea house called Hyoshintei and will explore the beautiful garden which has a pond in its center - typical for Japanese-style gardens. We will go to the museum next to the garden and then visit yet another beautiful garden called Yoshikien. We will relax at "Azumaya", a cottage at the top of a hill where we'll feel the nice summer evening breeze. The tour ends around 16:00-16:30. You can return the kimono to the hotel's front desk when you check out. In summer, you can also book the tour that includes a tea ceremony-making experience! Enjoy an elegant time with a tea master, study the traditional ways of making matcha tea, and then try them yourself!
strTitle: Wear a yukata and enjoy sightseeing in Nara

strIntroduction: Our traditional-style factory and Japanese model room is located in Ninomiya Station on the JR Tokaido Line in Kanagawa prefecture. We will pick you up from the station and take you to our factory (just 3 minutes away). In this activity you will have the opportunity to: - Visit a traditional Japanese wooden room where you will see important elements of Japanese house architecture such as a paper sliding doors (shouji), transom (ranma), and more. - Make a traditional wooden grid using a traditional binding method called "kude." The grid is made of Japanese hinoki cypress and is widely used in Japanese-style rooms. This activity is offered every day between 11am and 5pm.
strTitle: Join a traditional wooden grid workshop near Hakone

strIntroduction: We can take you to Shonan beach - the most famous beach in the Kanto region where you will see numerous beach bars open only during the summer time. Such beach bars are called hamajaya (浜茶屋) or uminoie (海の家). In Japan, they are temporary constructions and can be seen only during summer. Shonan beach is located about one hour train ride away from Tokyo. The beach bars sell casual food, snacks, shaved ice, and local dishes. Each bar has an unique concept, relaxing atmosphere, and usually has a roof so you that you can relax in the shade while you enjoying your drinks. Renting a bicycle is a nice way to explore the area. We can show you around more beaches or more uminoie bars along the coastline. Here are two example itineraries for this tour: Tour A: - Meet at Chigasaki Station - Rent a bicycle or walk to the beach (15 minutes from the station) - Visit the beach and the beach bars (1 hour) - Relax on the beach (35 minutes) - Stroll around on another beach (1 hour) - Go back to the rental office and the station Tour B: - Meet up at Hiratsuka Station - Rent a bicycle or walk to the beach (15 minutes from the station) - Visit a beach bar or do some marine sports (30 minutes) - Ride a bicycle to either Chigasaki or Oiso to visit more uminoie bars and feel the Pacific Ocean breeze in your hair (2 hour and 10 minutes) - Go back to the rental office and the station The price listed is per pair (but a single visitor can book for the same price too). More than two people should book per number of pairs. Example: 1 or 2 guests - book the option "price per pair" once 3 or 4 guests - book the option "price per pair" twice (two pairs) Optionally, you can book additional time or an electric bicycle! Enjoy summer with us!
strTitle: Explore the beach bars of the famous Shonan beach

strIntroduction: In this activity, you will learn how to make traditional Japanese dishes at a professional chef's house in Kobe. You will learn more about the Japanese food culture and styles of preparation. The menu is called "omotenashi course" and the content changes seasonally. You can always request to make certain dishes. In general, we will make 1 main dish, 2 side dishes, and a soup. Some examples of the dishes we'll make are sushi rolls, miso soup, clear clam soup, tempura, bento lunch box, okonomiyaki, and ginger pork teriyaki. Natural Kobe vegetables and condiments will be used. If you are vegetarian, please let me know in advance. The vegetarian menu can include tofu steak, miso soup, fried vegetable dumplings, kimpira, simmered pumpkin, tempura, and more. Please note that this is not a private class and you may be together with other guests in a group of up to 4 people. Classes start in the morning (9:00-12:00) or in the afternoon (13:00-16:00).
strTitle: Join a traditional cooking class with a chef in Kobe

strIntroduction: Hirado city in Nagasaki prefecture, Kyushu, is located on an island connected to the mainland by a spectacular suspension bridge. During the Age of the Great Navigators, Hirado was known as "Firando" among Dutch and Portuguese traders who established their trading warehouses in the city. At that time, Hirado was the domain of the powerful Matsuura clan who built a splendid castle on a top of a small hill overlooking the bay. Hirado is a city which amalgamated traditional Japanese, European, and East Asian influences. This is visible in the city's architecture and historical buildings. Up until the forceful relocation of the Dutch traders to Dejima, Nagasaki, Hirado flourished as a base for European merchants, Jesuit missionaries such as Francis Xavier, and scholars. The rich historical heritage of the city can be seen everywhere. At present, Hirado is part of Nagasaki's bid for becoming the next UNESCO World Cultural Heritage Site (Churches and Christian Sites in Nagasaki). In this half-day guided tour, you will visit some of Hirado's highlights and learn more about the prolific cultural interaction between the East and the West. After arriving to Hirado port/bus terminal, you will visit: - The historical hill district, where you can see an amazing panorama: Christian churches and Buddhist temples next to each other in perfect harmony. - St Francis Xavier Memorial Church, Hirado's largest cathedral built in 1913 to commemorate the legacy of the famous Jesuit missionary. - The giant palm tree, planted during the golden years of the Japan-Europe trade. - Matsuura Historical Museum, where you can learn about the local feudal clan Matsuura who ruled the island since the Kamakura period. - A brilliant reconstruction of the Dutch Trade House on the bay. Originally erected in 1609, shogun Tokugawa ordered it demolished in 1641 when the country adopted a policy of self-isolation. - Kameoka Park and Hirado Castle, another beautiful reconstruction of the impressive Hirado Castle that used to be the home of the Matsuura clan. After completing this tour you will know much more about the dynamic relationship between the Japanese and the Western traders during the turbulent, early years of the Edo period.
strTitle: Explore the rich historical heritage of Hirado, Nagasaki

strIntroduction: The Miho Museum is located deep in the forested hill, west of central Koka and can be visited as a short trip from Kyoto. It was designed by the world known architect, I. M. Pei, and is named after Koyama Mihoko, one of the richest women in Japan and the founder of the museum. Shigaraki is a ceramic town in Koka City, which is situated in southern Shiga, and known as the home for Shigaraki ware. It has one of the six oldest kilns in Japan and is known historically for its good clay. In this tour, you will visit both of these locations in one day! 9:00am JR Kyoto Station (Departure) ↓Train Go to JR Hieizan-Sakamoto Station ↓Walk Strolling around Sakamoto historic town - Shigain-Monzeki - Hiyoshitaisha shrine - Lunch ↓Funicular Strolling around To-do area of Enryakuji temple complex - To-do area - Sai-to area (Weather permitting) ↓Public Bus 5:00pm JR Kyoto Station (Return)
strTitle: Explore Sakamoto Historic Town and Mount Hiei in One Day!

strIntroduction: Fuji Five Lakes are a fantastic place to experience both nature and culture. They provide a breathtaking view to Mt Fuji that you will never get tired of. This tour will take you to the biggest Lake Kawaguchi and the nearby Lake Saiko for a full day of surprises and unforgettable experiences! First, you will visit the attractive Bat Cave which is more adventurous than other caves in Japan. Then you will enter the mystical and virgin Aokigahara Forest accompanied by a professional nature guide. Next in the itinerary is a visit to the quaint Iyashinosato Nenba folk village - a small copy of the popular thatched-roof houses village of Shirakawago. Here you will learn more about traditional art and craft. You'll have the opportunity to meet Japanese craftsmen and buy unique hand-made souvenirs. Finally, the Retro Bus will take you to two great museums near the shoreline of Lake Kawaguchi. Kawaguchiko Muse Museum has a peculiar display of dolls which look surprisingly realistic. Kubota Itchiku Art Museum has a fantastic exhibition of kimono items beautifully dyed with silk using traditional old Japanese techniques. Finally you will return to Tokyo (Shinjuku) full of memories and experiences you will never forget.
strTitle: Discover the wonders of Lake Kawaguchi in one day

strIntroduction: Mt Fuji is Japan's symbol, a UNESCO World Cultural Heritage Site and one of the most famous sightseeing spots among international travelers. Climbing to the summit of Mt Fuji is a quite strenuous task that can be accomplished only during the summer months and requires a lot of preparation. However, this tour will take you to the 5th Station halfway up the mountain and you will have the chance to walk around the forests through one of the popular trails - Ochudo Trail. Feel the spiritual energy of Mt Fuji all around you! Then you will take a bus down to Lake Kawaguchi which provides stunning views of Mt Fuji from a distance. Nearby is Kubota Itchiku Art Museum where you will enjoy an outstanding exhibition of beautifully decorated kimono items. The museum was founded by Kubota Itchiku, an artist who revived the traditional kimono silk dyeing techniques of old Japan. The museum's architecture as well as its gardens are impressive too. If the museum is closed you will visit the nearby Kawaguchiko Music Forest which is just as outstanding and impressive. Finally, you'll arrive back to Tokyo (Shinjuku) full of memories and experiences you will never forget!
strTitle: See Mt Fuji and Lake Kawaguchi: a nature and culture tour

strIntroduction: "Yatsushiro's funade-uki" is a traditional fishing method which originated from a boating entertainment popular with the local feudal lords in the past. It involves fishing using a large spear. In this tour, you will meet local fishermen and try traditional fishing methods used in Yatsushiro area. The catch changes depending on the season and can include crab, squids, shrimps, lobsters, octopuses, flounder fish and others. After the fishing experience, we will visit an uninhabited island off the Yatsushiro coast and will have a picnic with fresh seafood! You will be able to enjoy the one of the most beautiful rural places in Kumamoto prefecture, Kyushu. Spend a leisurely day with lots of sun, sea and delucious seafood!
strTitle: Join a sea picnic in Yatsushiro sea

strIntroduction: 8:30am We will pick you up in your hotel in Hiroshima City. You will meet and chat with your fellow group members, while enjoying views of the Japanese countryside on the way. 9:30am Tour a sake (Japanese rice wine) brewery popular among celebrities, tourists, and locals. Sample different types of sake in the brewery. If you find a new favorite, you can purchase it as a souvenir to take home. You can also purchase the sake that President Obama of the United States and Prime Minister Abe of Japan drank together. 11:00am You will learn how to make soba, buckwheat noodles, using locally-produced buckwheat flour. In this hands-on experience, local women who belong to the farming union in Hiroshima will teach you how to make soba in a friendly, open atmosphere where you can interact and socialize with other locals. 12:00pm After creating your own soba noodles, you'll be able to enjoy your creation with local seasonings for lunch. 2:00pm Option 1: Go back to Hiroshima City and go to the beautiful Japanese garden Shukkei-en. Relax and enjoy the scenic beauty of the Japanese garden. Japanese green tea and sweets are served as a refreshing snack. Option 2: You can choose to go to the Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park, dedicated to Hiroshima as the first city attacked by a nuclear attack. 4:00pm Enjoy the beautiful timbre (sound quality) of traditional Japanese instruments such as the koto (a traditional stringed instrument made of wood with 13 strings), hand drum, and shakuhachi (a bamboo woodwind instrument with five holes). After listening to the beautiful timbre, instructors will teach you how to play the musical instruments. The open and friendly atmosphere of the hands-on experience is good opportunity to be able to better understand Japanese culture.
strTitle: Tour a sake brewery and make soba during Hiroshima Day Trip

strIntroduction: 8:50am We will pick you up at your hotel in Hiroshima City. You will meet and chat with your fellow group members. 9:30am Visit Kumano Brush Craft Center, renown for producing quality brushes for Japanese calligraphy, cosmetics, and paint. Kumano brushes are designated as traditional crafts of Japan. In recent years, the high quality of its cosmetic brushes for makeup has been admired around the world. You can purchase these luxury makeup brushes in the Craft Center. 11:15am Tour a sake (Japanese rice wine) brewery popular among celebrities, tourists, and locals. Sample different types of sake in the brewery. If you find a new favorite, you can purchase it as a souvenir to take home. You can also purchase the sake that President Obama of the United States and Prime Minister Abe of Japan drank together. 12:30pm For lunch, we will enjoy fresh seafood served by local fishermen. They offer a variety of seasonal delicacies popular among culinary experts but little known to foreign tourists. 1:30pm After lunch, relax your mind and body at a hot spring spa while admiring spectacular panoramic views of the Seto Inland Sea. The visit to the hot spring spa is one of the most heavenly pleasures on this Hiroshima tour. 4:00pm Go back to Hiroshima City and go to the beautiful Japanese garden Shukkei-en. Relax and enjoy the scenic beauty of the Japanese garden. Japanese green tea and sweets are served as a refreshing snack.
strTitle: Discover hidden local spots during a Hiroshima Day Trip

Instructors will teach you in friendly, family atmosphere so you can interact and socialize with local people. After listening to the beautiful timbre, instructors will teach you how to play the musical instruments. The open and friendly atmosphere of the hands-on experience is good opportunity to be able to better understand Japanese culture.

strIntroduction: Japanese strawberries are loved not only by Japanese but also by people from all over the world because of their high quality, size and delicious taste. In this activity we will take you to a rural strawberry where you will have the chance to pick and eat as many strawberries as you can! This is a typical weekend experience for families in Japan that you will love too. The strawberry season is generally from January to May. We also recommend you try another activity we offer on Voyagin: "Make your own strawberry mochi rice cake!" The following is an example itinerary for this activity: 10:00 Meet at Shizuoka Station and go to the strawberry farm by bus. 11:00 Start picking and eating strawberries! 12:00 At this point you'll already be full and completely satisfied! 12:30 Take a bus back to Shizuoka Station. 13:30 End of tour
strTitle: Pick and eat as many strawberries as you like in Shizuoka

strIntroduction: The East Gardens of the Imperial Palace used to be Edo Castle of the Tokugawa Shogunate during the Edo period. The Edo period started in 1603 when Ieyasu Tokugawa established the Edo government in Edo (now Tokyo) and continued until 1868 when the Tokugawa Shogunate returned the political power to the Imperial court. Then Edo Castle became the Imperial Palace. The East Gardens, which are part of the Imperial Palace, were opened to the public in 1968. Old buildings and stone walls still remain as they were, even though large parts of the old castle have been destroyed. If you are interested in Japanese history and culture, would you like to enjoy and immerse yourself in the samurai world of the Edo period? After walking in the Imperial Palace's East Gardens, we go to Kyoto-kan where you can enjoy making and tasting Japanese matcha, powdered green tea, under the guidance of a professional instructor. Note: The tour is only held on Sundays and Saturdays.
strTitle: Visiting the remains of Edo-jo Castle and Tasting Matcha!

strIntroduction: Historical background: Before this tour for a better understanding, I would like to explain the history of Hikone Castle and Hikone town. Around the 16th century many feudal lords were fighting to rule this country. Finally Hideyoshi Toyotomi came to rule Japan. However, after his death, Ieyasu Tokugawa attempted to overthrow the Toyotomi family and rule over the country. Moreover, confrontations between a group whose leader was Ieyasu Tokugawa and another group that wanted to maintain the Toyotomi family escalated. They fought against each other in the battle of Sekigahara. Ieyasu Tokugawa won the battle and established the Tokugawa Shogunate. This was the beginning of the Edo period (1603-1868) and was the time when unique Japanese culture flourished. Naomasa Ii of the Ii family who was serving Ieyasu Tokugawa was transferred to Hikone as the first lord of the Hikone domain. After his death, his successor of the Ii family started building Hikone Castle and constructing the Hikone castle town. It took about 20 years to complete. The main purpose of this castle was to keep track of the movements of the Toyotomi family and other feudal lords who still continued to show loyalty to the Toyotomi family, and to protect the Emperor. Therefore, the castle was built as a base of the Tokugawa Shogunate and was well-prepared for a battle with the Toyotomi family. It had excellent military facilities for defense and offense. The castle is now a National Treasure and is located in Hikone town in Shiga Prefecture. Hikone faces Lake Biwa, which is the biggest lake in Japan. The most famous feudal lord among the Ii family was Naosuke Ii who was the 13th feudal lord of the Hikone domain. He was Tairo or chief minister of the Tokugawa Shogunate as well as a feudal lord. In 1853, the United States Fleet sailed into Japan. The commander, Matthew Perry, asked Japan to open the door to the United States. It was Ii Naosuke who signed the Treaty of Amity and Commerce between the United States and Japan without the Emperor's permission. Therefore, discontent grew in the Imperial Court and among some feudal lords. Moreover, Ii Naosuke punished over 100 people who opposed his foreign trade policies. As a result, on March 3, 1860, the Sakuradamon Incident occurred and he was assassinated by masterless samurais outside the Sakuradamon gate of the Edo Castle (Tokyo). It is believed that Ii Naosuke played an important role in Japanese history. The Ii family has been popular among ordinary people in this area and there are many temples and historic sites related to Ii family. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Tour Itinerary: After meeting you at JR Hikone Station, I will show you a statue of a warrior on a horse with armor and a helmet. This statue represents Naomasa Ii who was the 1st feudal lord of the Hikone domain. Along a street which leads to Hikone castle, we will stop by stone dealer’s stores dating back to the medieval ages. At these shops, there are Japanese-style garden lanterns and gravestones, as well as Buddha statues. After about a 15 minute walk from the station, we will visit Gokoku Shrine which enshrines people killed in wars. After that, we will see the middle moat and stone wall which are the entrances of the Hikone Castle complex. After seeing Sawaguchi-Tamon Yagura turrets and stables, which are important cultural assets, and crossing a bridge over the inner moat, we will enter the complex and confront a slope. Because this slope and the ensuing steps were designed irregularly to prevent invaders from entering the castle ground easily, you can easily run out breath. This design is one of the most excellent defense systems of the castle. After climbing up the slope, we will see a stone wall, a bridge and a road which is bent to a right angle. They also represent the excellent defense and offense construction of this castle. After passing under two turrets (Tenbin Yagura turret and Taikomon Yagura turret) which are Important Cultural Assets, we will arrive at Hikone Castle keep. Though this castle keep, which is a national treasure, is rather small, it was designed to focus on the outside beauty surrounding the castle. Inside the keep, you will find interesting castle constructions. Moreover, since this keep was built on the top of Mt. Hikone, you can get a full view of the surrounding area. After leaving the keep and descending down another slope, we will visit Genkyuen, the feudal lord’s garden which was created in 1677. It is a typical Japanese-style garden which features a circular walking path around a central pond. Beautiful views can be seen every season. After leaving Genkyuen garden, we will see the statue of Naosuke Ii who opened the country to the world. We will then visit the Hikone Castle Museum. There are many art and craft items collected by the Ii family, such as Japanese swords, Noh masks and costumes, red armor, and tea ceremony utensils, so you can see the Edo period’s culture and Japan’s beauty. Walking along the inner moat and crossing the middle moat, we will arrive at Yume (Dream) Kyobashi Castle Road and a temple complex. There are several temples associated with the Ii family. During emergencies, the temple complex was important for defense because soldiers stayed here and prepared for a battle. The Yume (Dream) Kyobashi Castle Road was built for tourists, so both sides of the street are lined with black-colored, old Japanese-style houses and the atmosphere of the Edo period is well-expressed. You can buy traditional Japanese souvenirs and eat traditional Japanese dishes, such as soba noodles, Omi beef, sukiyaki, and more. On your way back to JR Hikone Station, we will pass a kimono shop, an antique shop, and other interesting shops. You will also discover that the streets in the castle town were designed to prevent invaders from attacking the castle complex. At the end of the tour, you can visit many shops in a small department store in front of the station. Among the interesting ones is a 100-yen shop. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Schedule of the tour: I will pick you up at JR Hikone Station. The meeting time can be between 9:00 am and 2:00 pm, according to your schedule. The tour will take about 3-4 hours. Time required to reach Hikone Station by JR train: From Osaka: about 80 min. From Kyoto: about 50 min. From Nagoya: about 50 min (by Shinkansen + JR local train)
strTitle: Take a walking tour to Hikone Castle and the castle town

strIntroduction: Join our furoshiki wrapping workshop and learn more about a well-known, traditional aspect of Japanese culture! Furoshiki is a large, thin, and light square cloth used for wrapping objects. It can wrap many different things like wine bottles, clothes, watermelons, and laptops. If you have a bigger furoshiki, you can even wrap an entire yoga mat! Also, you can use this square-shaped cloth as an eco-friendly shopping bag. Furoshiki is really useful in everyday life. Nowadays, furoshiki isn't used by young people anymore. However, they are very useful and beautiful, and I'm sure you will discover something new about Japan through attending our workshop and learning about this historical tradition. The workshop is offered in English and takes place about 15 minutes away from JR Kichijoji or Mitaka Stations. It's held on weekends and national holidays. You can bring back 1 furoshiki as souvenir. :-) Below is the schedule for the activity: 1) 10 min: Short introduction about the history of furoshiki 2) 10 min: Choose your favorite furoshiki 3) 40 min: Learn several kinds of wrapping techniques Enjoy this cultural experience with us!
strTitle: 25% OFF Join a furoshiki wrapping workshop

strIntroduction: This is a great chance to explore the mecca of anime and technical devices Akihabara with a "kawaii" (cute) guide! Find hidden spots along the way and eat sushi in a rare-to-find "kawaii" sushi bar! Below you will find the itinerary for this tour: 13:20 - Meet at JR Akihabara Station Electric Town Exit 13:30 - The tour begins 16:00 - End of tour The itinerary will include the following spots: - Nadesico Sushi (where you will have lunch to get ready for the tour) - Electric parts street - Figurine shops - The Old Manseibashi Station - Duty-free shops - Gachapon experience - Souvenir shops for "moe" items The itinerary can be altered upon request. Please let us know in advance if there are any particular places you'd like to visit. The lunch menu includes: - Nigiri-zushi (4 pieces) (tuna, tuna belly, salmon, salmon with mayonnaise and cucumber) - California roll (1 roll) (cheese, avocado, lettuce) - Shrimp tempura sushi (rice with small shrimp) - Egg (omelette) Please note that this is not a private tour and there may be other participants joining. The tour is offered in English.
strTitle: Take an exciting tour in Akihabara with a kawaii guide

strIntroduction: This is a private tour for you, not group tour. Hakone is one of the most famous places for relaxation and sightseeing near Tokyo. Our trip starts from Shinjuku with the Hakone Freepass ticket. We'll take the Romance car or the special rapid train for a convenient and comfortable ride. You can drink, eat and see Mt.Fuji or Odawara Castle from the window. During the journey you can experience riding on various vehicles such as the Romance car, the special train on the steep slopes, the cable car, the ropeway, the sightseeing cruise ship and buses. You have chances to admire beautiful Mt.Fuji from the Romance car, the ropeway and the ship. At Owakudani, we will walk around a volcanic area and taste black eggs boiled in the hot springs. The ship ride is fantastic and great fun. Depending on your interests, we will go to various museums, or Hakone Shrine which dates back to the 8th century, or the historical Checkpoint used between 17-20th centuries of the Edo era. Other points of interest are the Odawara castle and we can even visit hot springs. There are so many attractive places to visit that you will have to choose where you want to go. Odawara has a famous fish port and you can enjoy very nice seafood such as Sashimi, Sushi, dried fish. Besides there are variety restaurants such as French, Chinese and Stake. Hakone is loved by political top leaders.
strTitle: Go on a one day trip to Hakone!

strIntroduction: Welcome to Akita prefecture, Japan! This delicious picnic lunch is the perfect way to experience Japan's rural nature. We will pack a delicious "bento box" (Japanese lunch box) full of Akita's local gourmet treats for you and bring you to our secret picnic spot at the lake, the valley, or the forest. We will choose the best seasonal location based on the weather and scenery! Below is a sample itinerary of this tour: - Pick-up at Kakunodate/Tazawako Station - Go to a secret spot introduced by us - Explore the area with an English-speaking guide - Enjoy a gourmet picnic lunch - Drop off at Kakunodate/Tazawako Station We will decide the exact location according to the season. Here are some of the places on our recommended list: Lake Tazawa Lake Tazawa is the deepest lake in Japan, reaching a depth of 423.4 meters. It is almost perfectly circular. The lake has a mysterious atmosphere, and it is filled with sapphire-blue water. The color changes from jade green to indigo blue, depending on the season and the depth of light that penetrates the water. It is a great attraction for visitors at anytime of the year. Dakigaeri Valley Dakigaeri Valley is one of the most beautiful valleys in Japan. The first thing you will see is Dakigaeri Shinto Shrine, after you cross a bridge and start the trip to this magnificent valley. You will walk over a narrow paved path along the river, then pass through pitch dark tunnels and caves until you finally reach impressive waterfalls. Beech Forest There are beautiful beech forests near the lake and also in the middle of the Nyuto Onsen hot spring area. The colors of the leaves change each season and the golden trees are especially beautiful in autumn! Cherry Blossom Trees If you missed the cherry blossom season in Tokyo, don't worry, there is almost a one month gap for the blooming of the cherry blossoms between Tokyo and Akita. The season is from the end of April to the beginning of May. Akita's cherry blossoms are not always in the park but can be found in the beautiful mountains and forests.
strTitle: Go on a picnic in the seasonal natural scenery of Akita

strIntroduction: This tour will take you on an easy cycle from the Snow Monkey Park down to the station of Yudanaka. The tour begins at the Snow Monkey Resorts Info and Gift Shop, located right in front of the trail entrance to the Jigokudani Monkey Park, and takes you through farmlands with rice paddies, blueberry fields and apple orchards to a historic hot spring village with a 1300 year history. The tour course is approximately 9.3 miles (15 km). 80% of the course is downhill while the rest consists of flat roads with some parts moderately uphill. It is a relatively easy course with no prior cycling experience necessary. During the tour, a knowledgeable tour leader will provide insight into local culture and history of the region and show you sights unique to the area. You will also get the chance to try local delicacies made by using hot spring sources. The tour ends at Yudanaka Station where there will be time to experience a refreshing foot spa to rest before continuing your journey! Tour itinerary: 13:30pm - Start at the Snow Monkey Resorts Info & Gift Shop. 16:00pm - Finish at Yudanaka Station. (Finishing time may vary depending cycling speed, taking photos, etc.)
strTitle: Join a Cycling Tour in Nagano around the Snow Monkeys area

strIntroduction: HiSUi Tokyo offers a variety of authentic cultural experiences for foreigners visiting Japan. Our aim is to make the Japanese culture easily accessible for travelers and contribute to the valuable memories that they will have from the trip to Japan. Our program consists of 4 different cultural activities. You can book one, several, or all four together. 1. Sado (Tea Ceremony) Experience After enter the tea room through the Nijiriguchi entrance, guests will receive a lecture on the tea room and the correct manners for enjoying sweets and matcha (green) tea. This is followed by the tea ceremony itself. The highlight of Sado! The Nijiriguchi is a small, square entrance to the tea room used to separate the realm of tea from the everyday outside world. By entering through this, you can experience Japanese culture firsthand. The instructors will explain why the Nijiriguchi is such a tiny entrance. All our sado instructors are certified specialists. They will be happy to answer any questions you may have. 2. Shodo (Japanese Calligraphy) Experience Guests will receive an explanation of the writing tools, and the correct manner in which to sit, and hold the brush. After warming up, one can practice the different brush strokes and flicks used in the art followed by writing their own name (in kanji). The highlight of Shodo! Guests will then have the opportunity to write their name on a small scroll and seal with a rakkan stamp. After creating your own piece of art, you can then take it back home as a unique souvenir. 3. Waso (Kimono) Experience The HiSUi Waso instructors will dress guests in kimono (Men will be provided with a haori), followed by a photo shoot. Guests can take part in other art forms while wearing kimono. The highlight of Waso! By wearing Kimono while taking part in batto or sado experiences, our guests can have a truly authentic experience of the Japanese culture. 4. Batto (Sword) Experience The HiSUi Tokyo instructor will demonstrate the art of shizan (trial cutting). For guests who wish to do so, there will then be the opportunity to try it for themselves in practice. The highlight of Batto! This stunning experience that allows you to actually cut with the real sword is somewhat of a rarity, even for those living in Japan. You can make a booking from 10AM to 5PM on weekdays (except Wednesdays). If your preferred date is on a weekend, please let us know. We will try to arrange the schedule depending on our availability. Please book at least 2 days before the day you would like to have the experiences.
strTitle: Join our all-inclusive Japanese culture experience program

strIntroduction: This is a full-week special Japanese lesson course near Fukuoka that will help you during your traveling and sightseeing in Japan. Please tell me your level of Japanese in advance. If your native language is not English, please tell me your native language. I will make my lesson suitable for you. Even if you don't understand Japanese at all, don't worry. I will give you some tips to enjoy Japanese conversation in your travel, no matter what your Japanese level is. During the first day, we will meet at Dazaifu Station near Fukuoka, then we will have the first lesson at a cafe in the backyard of Tenmangu Shrine. (Please pay for your tea. You can have umegae-mochi, sweet rice cake, if you like.) We will decide the lesson plan for the entire one week. The meeting place each day will be decided and we will discuss if you have any concerns or requests about the class. We will go through simulations of practical scenes, for example, in a hotel, a shop, or a station, depending on your level of Japanese. Everyday after the simulation, you will have the opportunity to use your Japanese in actual scenes while walking around the town. I will show you various aspects of Japanese daily life; we will stop at a post office, supermarket, library, etc. While we walk around the town, you may be able to spot and enjoy seasonal events held in Dazaifu or in Fukuoka. You have to book your hotel in Dazaifu or near Dazaifu by yourself. You will have 4-hour morning lessons for one week (7 days). The duration (number of days) can be negotiable. During this experience, we will enjoy Japanese conversations as much as possible. This program will not be available from 28th June to 16th October.
strTitle: One Week Special Japanese Lesson for Sightseeing in Fukuoka

strIntroduction: In this activity I will teach you useful and practical Japanese language in the pleasant surroundings of Fukuoka prefecture's best known shrine, Dazaifu Tenmangu. Meet at Dazaifu station at 10 am, then we will go to Tenmangu Shrine which is just a 5 minute walk away. In the backyard of Tenmangu, there are some tea houses and cafes. I will give you a lesson at one of the tea houses. (Please pay for your tea. You can have umegae-mochi, a sweet rice cake, if you like.) In this lesson, we will simulate various scenes, for example, in a hotel, a shop, or a station, depending on your level of Japanese. Please tell me your level of Japanese in advance, and I will make my lesson suitable for you. Even if you don't understand Japanese at all, don't worry. I will give you some tips to enjoy Japanese conversation in your travel, no matter what your Japanese level is. Then we will walk around the town. This is a great opportunity for you to practice your newly acquired Japanese skills. I will show you various aspects of Japanese daily life; we will stop at a post office, supermarket, library, etc. While we walk around the town, you may be able to spot and enjoy seasonal events held in Dazaifu. Last, we will have lunch at a cozy cafe. (Please pay for your lunch.) For Japanese people, meals means more than just a meal. There are special meals in every area in Japan. The characteristic of an area is often symbolized by its food. Talking about such meals and cultural aspects is the best way to get to know Japan and enjoy traveling. This experience will start at 10 am. If you prefer another time, let me know. During this experience, we will enjoy Japanese conversations as much as possible. This program will not be available from 28th June to 16th October.
strTitle: Half Day Special Japanese Lesson For Sightseeing in Dazaifu

strIntroduction: This is your unique chance to spend a wonderful night out in Tokyo or Kanagawa and dance in the powerful rhythm of salsa! Discover a new side of night life in Japan with me and join a great salsa party where you can dance all night! Please tell me your preferred date and any preferred style of salsa dance (LA style, NY style, Cuban style), if you have one. It's okay even if you don't have experience - I will recommend a place to go and will teach you how to dance salsa. I will pick you up from your hotel in central Tokyo and we'll go to a salsa club to have some great time together!
strTitle: Join a Salsa Party in Tokyo or Kanagawa!

strIntroduction: Do you want to experience playing traditional Japanese music casually? The instrument you can learn to play is called koto. Koto is such a wonderful instrument but there aren't so many places where you can try it. Therefore I'd like to welcome you to my place and teach you how to play! You can get to my place on Toden Arakawa Tram car. It's the only and the last still surviving tram line in Tokyo. From Nippori, it only takes about 20 minutes. I have been teaching koto for almost 40 years. I also play shamisen, another traditional Japanese instrument, that you can try too! You can play the koto easily by using special picks on three fingers or by pressing the thirteen strings. Enjoy the relaxing and beautiful tune of koto! The popular song Sakura (Cherry blossoms) is easy and good to start with. If you come in a group, the harmony between the instruments sounds fantastic. I hope you will have a great and memorable time with me! *My daughters will help me for the language and kimono dressing & hair arrangements. Available Wednesdays or Tuesdays.
strTitle: Experience traditional Japanese instruments Koto & Shamisen

strIntroduction: This activity is highly recommended for your free evenings in Okinawa's main city Naha. If you're confused and wonder what restaurant to enter on the bustling main Kokusai Street, this will definitely be the greatest choice for experiencing night life, culture and Okinawa's distinct cuisine! At Ryukyu Modern Classic Yotsutake you can enjoy a splendid stage show while having a delicious dinner with typical Okinawa dishes. The shows need prior reservation so don't miss your chance to experience the local atmosphere and spirit of the Ryukyu island culture! Two shows are held every night and you can only choose to watch one. The schedule is as follows: First show: 18:00 - entrance, dinner is served 18:30 - show begins 19:45 - show ends and you leave after taking photos with the performers Second show: 20:00 - entrance, dinner is served 20:30 - show begins 21:45 - show ends and you leave after taking photos with the performers You can choose not only which show to attend, but also which menu set to book in advance. Please select between: - pork shabu-shabu (thinly sliced pieces of meat and vegetables dipped in sauce) with Okinawa vegetable salads, noodle chample, seasonal desserts and others (9 items in total) - hikanzakura, consisting of pork ear skin, tofu peanuts, stewed pork belly, seasonal herbs and vegetables, seaweed, fruits and others (11 items in total) - himefuyu, consisting of Okinawan seaweed, pork tempura, pig feet, sesame-flavored steamed pork , vegetable salads, fruits and others (14 items in total) - pork steak with papaya salad, seaweed, goya chample, tofu peanuts, seasonal vegetables, fruits and others (12 items in total) In addition each group will be given the restaurant's original sata-andagi (sweet deep fried Okinawa doughnuts)!
strTitle: Enjoy Okinawa Dinner Yotsutake with a cultural show in Naha

strIntroduction: 【Japanese Exclusive Dining of Sake and Native foods】 Your "sake concierge" will escort you to one of Japan's native dining restaurants serving more than 50 brands of sake. 【Schedule】 - Greet you at JR Yotsuya Station at 7 pm. - Enjoy the taste of more than 50 brands of sake from all over Japan, all you can drink. - Enjoy Japanese cuisine that is the best in that season, such as fresh sashimi and side dishes of seasonal ingredients. - Learn from the sake concierge how to enjoy sake, types of sake, the history, the brewing process and more. Optional: Sake Brewery Tour You can be invited to the hidden parts of the sake breweries. You can see how top-ranked sake is produced at the actual site, and can enjoy tasting the sake which is just freshly produced there and you cannot find at the market. If you have any further questions, don't hesitate to contact us. We will arrange the schedule for you. This tour requires a minimum of 3 and a maximum of 20 participants to be held. As a single traveler or a pair you can join only if there is a tour with other people scheduled. Please contact us for availability.
strTitle: The Sake and Japan's Native Dining Tour of Tokyo

strIntroduction: We will stroll the famous Sake production area in Kobe. The area is named Nada and has been a renowned Sake production area since the Edo period. In this tour we will visit two breweries. The tour starts at 10 am at Sumiyoshi Station on Hanshin Railways Kobe line. The meeting point is outside the ticket gate in the the station. We will walk for about 10 minutes to the first brewery. You can enjoy the museums inside and complimentary Sake tasting. Then the second brewery is 10 minutes walk away from the first one. You will have chance for shopping in the attached stores next to the breweries. Sake sold in the brewery is kept in the best preservation and storing conditions. You will see really high rate Sake in the stores. Then we will walk through the nice riverside promenade to get to Uozaki Station in about 10 minutes. The tour will finish at the station. Taxi can be arranged with extra cost from the last brewery to your destination if you do not want to take a train after the tour. Taxi fee to the nearest train station will be approximately 8 USD. If you like to visit Central Kobe after the tour, it takes about 15 minutes by train from Uozaki Station. The port of Kobe is one of the first commercial ports to open for international trade after the long national isolation during the Edo era.
