strIntroduction: This is a full-day program in Kamakura/Shonan area with a bilingual guide. Program begins with a rickshaw ride in Kamakura and goes around secret sightseeing spots. You will see the main cultural sites while walking along Kamakura alps, as well as the beautiful scenery from the hill, followed by a Shojin Ryori lunch, which is Japanese vegetarian cuisine originally derived from the dietary restrictions of Buddhist monks. Enoshima Dentetsu railway not only takes you to even more sightseeing spots including the great Buddha, but you will also feel like experiencing a nostalgic part of the Japanese local life. Itinerary: Kamakura station → Rickshaw ride and visit of sightseeing spots → Nature walk in Kamakura Alps → Shojin Ryouri Lunch → Enoshima Dentetsu local train ride and visit of sightseeing spots including Great Buddha → Island of Enoshima.
strTitle: Take a Kamakura/Shonan Day trip with rickshaw/Enoden

strIntroduction: Guiding will be done in English and beginners are welcome to play! Quick instruction session will be held at the beginning, followed by playing time. Very easy to play and it's so much fun! Playing field is located in a building, so weather condition does not matter. *No shoes rentals. You should wear sneakers, no sandals. *Please pick a location from Tokyo (Odaiba or Akihabara), Nagoya, Osaka.
strTitle: Try a Survival Game Experience in Tokyo, Nagoya, Osaka

strIntroduction: Mt Yoshino is located south of Nara city and is known as the oldest and most famous sakura cherry tree blossoms spot in Japan. The first trees were planted over 1300 years ago and now there are over 30 000 of them along the elegant slopes of the mountain. What makes this place special is not just the outstanding number of sakura trees but also their specimen variety. The trees were planted in four different groves at different altitudes with the idea to blossom at different times during the spring. Yoshino town is a rural and idyllic little town located at the base and along the lower parts of the mountain. Here you will find plenty of attractive little restaurants and cafes. There are plenty of sakura blossoms along the shopping streets. Take the ropeway, the shuttle bus or hike towards the next level where you will reach the impressive Kinpusenji Temple and Yoshimizu Shrine, registered as UNESCO World Cultural Heritage Site in 2004. The view to the sakura-covered slopes from Yoshimizu Shrine is particularly rewarding. Further along the hiking trails you will reach several pleasant parks which are popular hanami (cherry appreciation) picnic spots for local people. You can see the best views of the sakura groves along the mountain slopes from Hanayagura observatory near the top of the mountain. The sakura trees at Mt Yoshino blossom in different periods from late March to early May which makes this place attractive for your spring trip to Japan. Don't miss the chance to see Japan's best sakura spot which has been included in famous historical poem collections of the past!
strTitle: Enjoy sakura in Japan's most famous cherry tree spot in Nara

strIntroduction: Prepare for your Hokkaido trip by planning a ski tour! There are 3 local ski areas and 6 hot springs near Memanbetsu Airport. Lift tickets, equipment and meals are at your expense. I have a ski instructor's licence certified by Ski Association of Japan. I can pick you up to the place where you stay near Memanbetsu Airport and take you to the ski area and then to the hot spring. Please bring your own ski wear. However you can rent wear and ski/snowboard sets at Lake view ski area. Ski set is 2500 JPY for one day. Local hot springs require towels and shampoo. Here is a model plan for your trip: 5:00pm Meet up at Ski Area 5:00pm to 9:00pm Ski Lesson 9:00pm Back to your accommodation There are many different ski areas and hot springs around Memanbetsu Airport. You can choose where to go!
strTitle: Go Skiing in Northeast Hokkaido!

strIntroduction: This tour offers you the full package of enjoying sake! You will totally, perfectly enjoy sake following the steps below: <1. Sake brewery (Sakakgura)> We will take you to a sake brewery where you will learn step-by-step how sake is made, and also experience sake tasting. You can also buy one of the most fresh and finest Japanese sake here as a souvenir! <2. Hot spring (Onsen)> We will take you to a hot spring, where you can shed the sweat from studying hard at the brewery! We'll get you well prepared for drinking sake. <3. Local pub (Izakaya)> Finally, we will take you to an excellent local Izakaya where you can drink fresh sake and have a delicious meal. <<Time schedule>> 13:30 Meet at Oume station, move to the brewery. ↓ Explore the brewery and enjoy sake tasting. Go to a sake store. ↓ Depart the brewery and move to the Onsen. Take a nice bath. ↓ Depart the Onsen and move to Izakaya. Enjoy drinking. ↓ 21:00 After drinking we will take you to Tachikawa station. We accept your requests. Please contact us for any questions!
strTitle: Sake Mastering Tour: Visit Brewery, Hot Springs, Local Pubs
